column4: what do I need to install in ubuntu to get my video card to work correctly using vbox?
I want to increase my screen resolution
yeah
I didnt install guestadditions
ok doing it now
win7
oh
let me see if there is an option
Virtualbox has a menu option when you start the VM (somewhere, my memory is a touch fuzzy) to install the guest additions.
That file is the additions for a Windows guest, as the name suggests.  There should be something more suited to Ubuntu.
That's the bunny.
If it's fewer, check in Win7 if any of them start with a ".".  If it's more in Ubuntu, that's because it's showing hidden files.
its less in ubuntu
Then I am not sure, but if any start with a . or end with a ~ they'll be hidden by Nautilus, maybe that's it?
its not even the same names
Not sure then, sorry...
Just click the network-manager applet?
where is that app
In Ubuntu, it's installed by default and should be in your tray.  It's the same tool you use to connect to wifi.
Top right.
is there another place that lists all the networks besides top right
my wireless adapter light keeps flickering like it is busy.  Is Ubuntu querying the device constantly or something
Could be, but if it's a built-in wireless device there have been known issues with the LED not being driven properly, so that it's essentially lying to you.
its external usb device
